sections.title: Unchained Monk (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Unchained Monk class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks are proficient with specific weapons and cannot wear armor or shields without losing class abilities. Wearing armor, using shields, or carrying medium/heavy loads disables AC bonus, fast movement, and flurry of blows.

sections.title: AC Bonus (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: When unarmored and unencumbered, monk adds Wisdom bonus to AC and CMD, plus a scaling bonus that increases every 4 levels. These bonuses apply against touch attacks and when flat-footed but are lost when immobilized or helpless.

sections.title: Bonus Feat (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks gain bonus feats from a specific list at 1st, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, with additional feats becoming available at 6th and 10th level. Prerequisites are waived for these feats.

sections.title: Flurry of Blows (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: As a full-attack action, monks gain additional attacks at their highest base attack bonus, stacking with haste and similar effects. At 11th level, they gain one more additional attack during flurry.

sections.title: Stunning Fist (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks gain Stunning Fist as a bonus feat and can apply different conditions (fatigued, sickened, staggered, blind/deaf, paralyzed) instead of stunning at higher levels. The monk chooses the effect before attacking.

sections.title: Unarmed Strike (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks gain Improved Unarmed Strike and deal scaling lethal damage with unarmed attacks using full Strength bonus. Unarmed strikes count as both manufactured and natural weapons for spell effects.

sections.title: Evasion (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: On successful Reflex saves against attacks that normally deal half damage, the monk takes no damage instead. Only works in light armor or no armor and not when helpless.

sections.title: Fast Movement (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks gain an enhancement bonus to land speed that increases with level. This bonus is lost when wearing armor or carrying medium/heavy loads.

sections.title: *Ki* Pool (Su) (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks gain a ki pool for supernatural abilities and ki strike that treats unarmed attacks as different weapon materials for overcoming damage reduction. Spending ki allows extra attacks during flurry of blows.

sections.title: *Ki* Power (Su) (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks select ki powers every 2 levels starting at 4th level that grant mystical abilities by spending ki points. Powers have level requirements and cannot be changed once selected.

sections.title: Still Mind (Ex) (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against enchantment spells and effects.

sections.title: Purity of Body (Ex) (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks become completely immune to all diseases, including supernatural and magical diseases.

sections.title: Style Strike (Ex) (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: During flurry of blows, monks can designate unarmed strikes as style strikes with additional effects like tripping, stunning, or dealing extra damage. Multiple style strikes become available at higher levels.

sections.title: Improved Evasion (Ex) (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: The monk's evasion improves so that failed Reflex saves result in half damage instead of full damage, while successful saves still negate damage completely.

sections.title: Tongue of the Sun and Moon (Ex) (Unchained Monk)
sections.anchor_heading: #### Tongue of the Sun and Moon (Ex) {#tongue_of_the_sun_and_moon_ex}
sections.description: Monks can understand and speak with any living creature as if under a permanent tongues effect.
keywords: tongue of the sun and moon

sections.title: Timeless Body (Ex) (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks no longer take ability score penalties for aging and cannot be magically aged, though existing penalties remain and they still die of old age.

sections.title: Flawless Mind (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks roll twice on Will saves and take the better result, and can attempt new saves each hour against long-duration Will save effects.

sections.title: Perfect Self (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks become outsiders for spell purposes, gain DR 10/chaotic, and can enter perfect calm to regain ki at 1 point per 10 minutes.

sections.title: Old Master (Ex) (Unchained Monk)
sections.description: Monks gain one additional attack at highest base attack bonus during flurry of blows and increase their dodge bonus to AC by 2.
